The Administration owes us answers on whether it knew about Russia‚Äôs efforts to encourage violence against U.S. troops and our allies, but one thing is clear: attacks are on the rise and there‚Äôs no clear plan to stop the violence and keep the peace. https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/27/world/asia/afghanistan-taliban-human-rights-workers.html

It doesn‚Äôt pass the sniff test that the President wasn‚Äôt briefed on such an explosive piece of intelligence, but if he wasn‚Äôt what does that say? A Commander in Chief uninterested in the safety of our troops or an Intel community that doesn‚Äôt trust him. Incompetence either way.

Did Donald Trump know Russia was putting a bounty on American lives in Afghanistan when he said ‚Äúwe have this great friendship?‚Äù Did he know when he suggested Russia should attend the G7? Someone in the administration knew and they did nothing.
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/26/us/politics/russia-afghanistan-bounties.html?referringSource=articleShare
Something has been off about that relationship since the beginning, and Americans are quite literally paying in blood for his pandering to Putin.
Of all the ways this president has broken with tradition of past presidents, his constant yielding to the Russians is up there as the most confounding and strategically damaging to U.S. interests.

The fact that staff drew up response options but somehow no one informed the Pres. seems to reflect an entrenched feeling that, at best the Pres. needed plausible deniability, & at worst they assessed Trump would sacrifice US troops for his relationship with Putin & the Taliban.
If they thought the President would have done the right thing and defended the lives and honor of our American troops in Afghanistan, they would have told him immediately.

... both because of the implications with the Russians, and with the Taliban who the President was negotiating with in real time.

Either the senior staff was truly incompetent, or worse: they purposely withheld the info for fear it would disrupt the President‚Äôs relationships.

I‚Äôm at a loss on the news that the White House knew Russian operatives were paying bounties for Taliban attacks on U.S. & NATO soldiers.
